Articles.Content:
I know the wiki says this is impossible, but what would happen if Jool and Eeloo could and did collide? Would they just clip through each other, or blow up? Any ideas?

Edited May 17, 2013 by Rainbowtrout

Spelt Jool wrong

EDIT: Not anymore!

Edited May 17, 2013 by Rainbowtrout
100% Clipping, you can try this with Hyperedit and make for example Mun and Kerbin collide

They would clip through each other. Did you watch suestragaming's "messing around with hyperedit" videos?

Edited May 10, 2013 by astropapi1
Thanks for the help! Time to make the sun collide with Kerbin now!
They'd probably just clip if you were looking at them from the map. If you happened to be in orbit in the area, weird things would probably happen, most likely ending in the game crashing.

Spelt Jool wrong

You can edit your first post, including the title of the thread, with the Go Advanced button while editing the post.
On a related note: What happens when you have something landed on the surface of one planet, then another body clips through it coming from "under" the lander? Has anyone investigated that?

On a related note: What happens when you have something landed on the surface of one planet, then another body clips through it coming from "under" the lander? Has anyone investigated that?

My guess is that since the game sees it as "Landed on Planet X" it wouldn't do anything. Now, if you were to puff off the ground a bit, then maybe you could transfer.. I don't know..

I know the wiki says this is impossible, but what would happen if Jool and Eeloo could and did collide? Would they just clip through each other, or blow up? Any ideas? PS spelt Jool wrong

Nothing.

By knowing how this game works, they'll just go past each other
